children.value: Thinking about typography, one of the central aspects to type is readability. I had the idea that if one averaged all of a system's fonts together, you would get the most readable form of each letter by what each font had in common.
I created a D3 javascript function that overlaid each system font on top of each other at a 5% opacity.
You can see the fonts below.

children.value: Some of the fonts are able to load in all browsers natively without import, so the font has a different appearance on each browser.

children.value: Another function of this is transforming each x, y, and angle positions of the font. I used this idea to play around with different types of movement. I focused on just creating different possibilities for the letter "o".
